definition: to erase/to cover traces/to obliterate evidence/to expunge/to blot out/to suppress
to smear/to wipe/to erase/classifier for wisps of cloud, light-beams etc
to kill/to murder/to attack/to weaken or reduce/to smart (dialect)/(used after a verb) extremely
to blot out at one stroke/to reject out of hand/to deny without a hearing

sentences.english: Crowning "stars" among literary upstarts is killing them.
sentences.chinese: 把所谓“明星”捧做文唐袈贵即是抹杀他们。

sentences.english: Fan argued that the exam system stunts individual interests and talents.
sentences.chinese: 范谊认为，高考抹杀了学生的个性和天赋。

sentences.english: Or would a free ticket have  destroyed your  motivation?
sentences.chinese: 抑或这张免费票会抹杀你的奋斗动机？

sentences.english: We've passed through a century during which many indigenous languages were wiped out or pushed to the brink of extinction.
sentences.chinese: 几世纪来，许多土语遭到抹杀或是一夕之间消失。

sentences.english: And then he denies his insincerity by doing so.
sentences.chinese: 于是，在承认的同时，也就一笔抹杀了自己的不真诚。

sentences.english: This silences the doctrine of justification regardless of the official commitments of our churches.
sentences.chinese: 这必定抹杀我们在教会里所教导的因信称义教义。

sentences.english: Reality, kill too much like real unreal image.
sentences.chinese: 现实，抹杀了太多如真似幻的意象。

sentences.english: But it can kill the spirit of an entrepreneur to spend too much time in a big company.
sentences.chinese: 在是在一个大公司淫浸太久会抹杀你的创业精神。

sentences.english: Consequently the first condition of progress is the removal of censorship.
sentences.chinese: 这样一来，进步的首要条件就被审查抹杀了。

sentences.english: This merit will shine throughout history and no one can obliterate it.
sentences.chinese: 这一功绩彪炳史册，是任何人也抹杀不了的。

sentences.english: It tends to confound and destroy all distinctions, and prostrate all ranks to one common level.
sentences.chinese: 这将混淆和抹杀所有区别，削平所有等级。

sentences.english: However, globalization and cultural collectivism today are wiping out their individuality.
sentences.chinese: 然而今天全球化和文化集体制抹杀了这个族群的个性。

definition: variant of 抹殺|抹杀[mo3 sha1]
to deprive/to expropriate/to strip (sb of his property)
to fall down/to decay/to fall from the sky/to die
